Nat.pow_succ n m says that n ^ m.succ = n ^ m * n, while in a monoid, pow_succsays n^ m.succ = n * n ^m.

This PR matches the definition of pow_succ in the definitions of a monoid, group, etc. so that mathlib is self-consistent.

The meanings of pow_succ and pow_succ' are changed, nsmulRec and zsmulRec are adjusted, as well as more than 250 files.

Essentially, the matter was to prime/unprime the application, or to change a left/right. In one case, I had to add a new function.
I took the opportunity to remove a porting Note (continuity sufficed), and to adjust one or two docstrings.
(The naturality of this proposition should be self obvious, since pow_succ used to say that pow is an antihomomorphism from Nat to the given monoid.)
(Up to now, mathlib compiles, but there are issues with the test files.)
Now that you've done this PR, I should mention that !3#18077 would be a much more seamless change!
